answers.answer: This could be from a nerve being compressed...could also have something to do with diabetes, menopause, low magnesium levels, etc. Many people complain of this.In most cases it seems that it is a muscle twitching...much like the twitch that you sometimes get under your eye. If you've never experienced an eye twitch I feel for you...it's the oddest thing in the world...and gets very annoying after a few minutes. lolI believe in your case it would be a muscle twitch.You may want to see a chiropractor or a doctor for help in controlling this.

question: i have repeated twiches that rise me out the bed every night and it comes from the left side of my chest.
title: twiches
